articles.title: The corona effect: Why governments and central banks face a challenge like never before - The Globe and Mail
articles.description: As the spreading virus sends markets into a tailspin, policy makers are rushing to provide an economic lifeline. But will it be enough?
articles.content: That tearing sound you hear is economic forecasts being ripped up and thrown in the trash. Over the past few days, the continuing spread of the dangerous new coronavirus has driven the Bank of Canada and the U.S. Federal Reserve to slash interest rates, promp… [+16037 chars]

articles.author: The Globe And Mail
articles.title: Tim Hortons suspends cup giveaway, won’t use refillable containers amid coronavirus concerns
articles.description: The coffee-and-doughnuts chain says it is suspending a plan to give away 1.8 million reusable cups part of its Roll Up the Rim to Win contest
articles.content:
Tim Hortons was planning on giving away 1.8 million reusable cups, seen here with a white lid, as part of its Roll Up The Rim promotion but has suspended the program over coronavirus concerns.
Melissa Tait/The Globe and Mail
Tim Hortons is suspending a plan… [+3184 chars]
